TEXT.English: Bison
TEXT.French: Bison
TEXT.German: Bison
TEXT.Italian: Bisonte
TEXT.Spanish: Bison

TEXT.English: Bison are born without their trademark hump and horns and live for approximately twenty years. They grow to maturity at two to three years, although males continue to grow until about their seventh year. Adult bulls express a high degree of dominance competitiveness during mating season. Male bison fight for females and these fights often result in injury or death. After the bison mate, the herd splits up into smaller herds. Calves are born nine months after mating. The mothers take care of and nurse their young for a year. Male bison grow to as much as to 11.5 feet (3.5m) long, and 6.5 feet (2m) tall at the shoulder and can weigh up to 2200lbs (998 kg).
TEXT.French: Les Bisons naissent sans leur bosse et leurs cornes reconnaissables, et vivent environ 20 ans. Ils atteignent l'âge adulte vers deux ou trois ans, même si les mâles continuent de grandir jusqu'à leur 7 ans. Les mâles expriment une forte tendance à la bagarre à la domination durant la saison des amours. Le Bison mâle se bat souvent pour les femelles et ces luttes se terminent souvent pour des blessures ou la mort. Après l'accouplement, le troupeau se sépare en troupeaux plus réduits. Les femelles vêlent 9 mois plus tard, et s'occupent et nourissent leurs petits pour un an. Les Bisons mâles peuvent atteindre 3,5 m de long et 2 m au garrot, et peuvent peser jusqu'à 1100 kg.

I bisonti maschi possono arrivare ad essere lunghi 3.5m e alti, alla spalla, 2m e pesare sino ai 998 kg.

TEXT.German: Bleeding God Wine
TEXT.Italian: Bleeding God Wine
TEXT.Spanish: Bleeding God Wine

TEXT.English: Bleeding Gods were once sea giants used by Danalin to defend his islands during the Godswar. But since Danalin has gone mad they have followed. Now these great towering creatures swim through the ocean eternally bleeding. Turning the water red in their wake, and usually shadowed by a herd of equally crazed sharks. The "Gods" bear little direct ill will toward humanity but will occasionally lash out at a ship, tearing it to pieces and dumping the sailors into the ocean where the sharks wait.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Bleeding God wine, said to be from the bloody water these creatures have passed through, is dangerous to gather and highly valued by the Balseraphs, and is said to cause madness. Patrian Mages used it ritually in sacrifices to Agares.

TEXT.French: Chameau
TEXT.German: Kamel
TEXT.Italian: Cammello

TEXT.English: Camels are even-toed ungulates within the genus Camelus. The dromedary, one-humped or Arabian camel has a single hump and is well known for its healthy low fat milk, and the Bactrian camel has two humps. They are native to the dry desert areas of western Asia, and central and east Asia, respectively. The term camel is also used more broadly to describe any of the six camellike creatures in the family Camelidae: the two true camels, and the four South American camelids, the llama, alpaca, guanaco, and vicuña. The average life expectancy of a camel is 40 to 50 years. A fully grown adult camel stands 1.85 m (6 ft 1 in) at the shoulder and 2.15 m (7 ft 1 in) at the hump. The hump rises about 30 inches (75 cm) out of its body. Camels can run up to 65 km/h (40 mph) in short bursts and sustain speeds of up to 40 km/h (25 mph). Fossil evidence indicates that the ancestors of modern camels evolved in North America during the Palaeogene period, and later spread to most parts of Asia. Humans first domesticated camels before 2000 BC. The dromedary and the Bactrian camel are both still used for milk, meat, and as beasts of burdenthe dromedary in western Asia and in Africa north of the sub-Saharan savannahs, and the Bactrian camel further to the north and east in central Asia.

TEXT.English: A Letter on Cowing[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]To my son Adonijah at the Nimarail School of the Arcane,[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]My son, I am writing to you to warn you of your future. Magic is a risky business! Too risky for a poor son of mine, I reckon. So I urge you to take up cowing instead. Im a cower, and I have earned a great deal of money through the business. Havent you ever wondered why I have such a nice home for all the cows?[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Cowings a respectable business, unlike that death magic stuff your learning. Why raise the dead when you can raise a cow? Cows dont hurt you; cows dont attempt to kill you like those skeletons do. And if you like the death part of death magic, then theres plenty of that in cowing, too! You even get to eat the cows you kill  or sell them for a profit. Dead cows are just as good as live cows, I say.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]With cows you can do countless things, unlike death magic. With death magic all you can do raise the dead or summon some spirits or become a lich. With cows you can eat them, milk them, sell them live, sell them dead, sell their milk, you can even sell the sick ones to Balseraph noblemen to use as projectiles. Also, they warn you of coming storms. Does death magic do all those things? I think not.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]I urge you, Adonijah, to drop out of school and become a cower.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Your loving father,[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Nikud

TEXT.English: The Desert Rose is a rare desert plant which produces a poison that leaves its victims in excruciating pain that continues undiminished for the rest of their lives, and has no known cure. It is highly valued by the Council of Esus.
TEXT.French: La rose du désert est une plante désertique rare, dont on extrait un terrible poison. L'atroce souffrance qu'il inflige à ses victimes persiste sans s'atténuer jusqu'à leur mort. Aucun antidote n'a été trouvé à ce jour. Ce poison est très apprécié du Conseil d'Esus.

TEXT.English: Fruit of Yggdrasil
TEXT.French: Fruit d'Yggdrasil
TEXT.German: Frucht des Weltenbaumes Yggdrasil
TEXT.Italian: Frutto di Yggdrasil
TEXT.Spanish: Fruta de Yggdrasil

TEXT.English: The bounty of Yggdrasil is the finest of foods, said to offer increased strength and health to those that consume it. They grace the tables of kings and are offered to injured heroes to help speed their healing.
TEXT.French: Le don d'Yggdrasil est la plus fine des nourritures, supposée donner une plus grande force et une meilleure santé à ceux qui le consomment. Ils honorent les tables des rois et sont offerts aux héros blessés pour accélérer leur guérison.
TEXT.German: Die Gaben des Yggdrasil sind die feinste Nahrung. Angeblich verbessern sie die Kraft und Gesundheit derer, die sie essen. Diese Gaben schmücken die Tische der Könige und werden oft verletzten Helden angeboten, um deren Heilungsprozess zu beschleunigen.
TEXT.Italian: I frutti di Yggdrasil sono i più raffinati di tutti i cibi, si dice conferiscano forza e benessere a coloro che li mangiano. Sono presenti sulle tavole dei re e vengono offerti agli eroi feriti per aiutarli a guarire.
TEXT.Spanish: El don del Yggdrasil es el mejor de los alimentos, del que se dice que incrementa la fuerza y la vitalidad de aquellos que lo consumen. Adornan las mesas de los reyes y son ofrecidas a héroes heridos para acelerar su curación.

TEXT.English: Often known as Blasting Powder, Gunpowder is a new innovation of the Age of Rebirth, and some say it signals the coming of a new age without magic.
TEXT.French: Souvent appelée Poudre Explosive, la Poudre à Canon est une innovation de l'Âge de la Renaissance et certains disent qu'elle est annonciatrice d'un nouvel âge sans magie.
TEXT.German: Auch bekannt als "Sprengpulver" ist Schwarzpulver eine neue Erfindung des Zeitalters der Wiedergeburt, und manche denken, es würde ein neues Zeitalter der Magie einläuten.
TEXT.Italian: Spesso conosciuta come Polvere Esplosiva, la Polvere da Sparo è un'invenzione dell'Era della Rinascità, e si dice che segni l'inizio di una nuova era senza magia.
TEXT.Spanish: También conocida como Polvo Explosivo, la Pólvora es una nueva innovación de la Edad del Renacimiento, y hay quien dice que señala la llegada de una nueva edad sin magia.

TEXT.French: Jeteye
TEXT.German: Jeteye
TEXT.Italian: Jeteye

TEXT.English: An addictive drug that sedates and can cause horrible hallucinations, it turn the entire iris and sclera of the user black. It is administered by squirting the liquid inside the eyelid.[PARAGRAPH:2]The Nether Blade is stored in the Bay of Laurus and Os-Gabella ends up traveling to the city to attempt to find it and use it to end her immortal life. Before she does so she discovers the Jeteye dealers of the cities ports and finds some measure of escape in the delusions and opiate dreams the drug offers. Somewhere among the cities beggars the first human lives in squaller, once queen of the Sheaim, once grandmother to the Calabim, once unwilling bride to the god Nemed, her world is now little more than visions and dancing shadows. More than one man seeking to abuse or hurt the cities beggars has met his end when he assumed Os-Gabella was just another broken vagrant.

TEXT.English: Why do I like studying air magic? Oh sure, you don't get to hurl fireballs or raise the dead. But it's great fun. More an art then a science, really, with plenty of room for creativity. You can completely wing it, not learn a single formal spell, and still do well just by willpower and ingenuity. Besides, controlling the wind has many suprising uses, especially considering the length of most girl's skirts these days. -Adept Morin

TEXT.English: You can tell a lot about a mage by their preferred sphere. Take Korven there. Earth adept. Not too bright, but honest. He's hardworking and a bit stubborn. TEXT.English: For any nonmagical process, you cannot get out more energy then you put in. At first, magic was assumed to be different; you could put in the effort of a few words and get raw energy out, more than you put in. Interestingly, we've been studying the inner workings of magic and have found that with every spell, a little power gets... lost. We even determined where that power ends up, and have recently managed to harness that "lost" power... -3rd entry in Archmage Fulton's journal[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]We live such short lives. A single death, a hundred deaths, a million deaths... I'd sacrifice them all. People live their pathetic little lives and then die. Nobody really matters on this dying rock. But I'd like to at least enjoy my time on this wretched world before I go to Hell. -12th entry in Archmage Fulton's journal

TEXT.English: It was the last day of my apprenticeship, the first day I could claim the title Adept. My master brought me to this hilltop and sat. By his silence, I knew he was awaiting the answer to an unasked question. This time, as usual, I didn't know what was expected of me. I looked around, searching. After a time, as he continued to gaze at me, I grew frustrated. I was about to speak, to ask for the riddle so I could begin to answer it, when suddenly I felt-nay, tasted the glorious stuff for the first time. The Ether. My eyes betrayed my ecstasy, and my master smirked knowingly. He arched his eyebrow. I answered, finally, with one word. "Power."

Durch sein Schweigen wusste ich, dass er eine Antwort auf eine unausgesprochene Frage erwartete. Wie immer wusste ich nicht, was von mir erwartet wurde, also schaute ich mich suchend um. Nach einer Weile, während er mich fortwährend anstarrte, wurde ich ungeduldig. Ich öffnete meine Lippen, um nach der Aufgabe fragen, da spürte  nein kostete  ich es plötzlich zum ersten Mal. Den Äther. Mein Augen müssen meine Verzückung verraten haben, den mein Meister grinste vielsagend. Erwartungsvoll hob er seine Augenbrauen und ich antwortete mit einem einzigen Wort: "Macht".
TEXT.Italian: Era l'ultimo giorno del mio apprendistato, il primo giorno in cui potevo fregiarmi del titolo di Adepto. Il mio maestro mi portò su questa collina e si sedette. Dal suo silenzio sapevo che stava aspettando una risposta a una domanda non posta. Quella volta, come al solito, non sapevo cosa si apettasse da me. Io guardavo in giro, cercando. Dopo un pò, mentre continuava a fissarmi, diventavo sempre più frustrato. Stavo per parlare, per chiedere quale fosse l'indovinello cosi da poter rispondere, quando all'improvviso percepii per la prima volta la sensazione gloriosa dell'etere. I miei occhi tradirono la mia estasi, e il mio maestro sorrise compiaciuto. Lui arcuò le sopracciglia. Io risposi, finalmente, con una parola. "Potere."

With such power at our call, what threat could ever endanger our glorious republic?"[PARAGRAPH:2][ITALICS]Excerpt from The Vanity of the Aifons, Bernado Juvenal

TEXT.English: [TAB]First discovered in the Age of Magic, Mithril is stronger and lighter than steel. Dwarves, the first to discover it, used to spread the rumor that the white metal was actually carved dragon bone and laughed as their competition marched off into dragon lairs to attempt to recover some. Today the tradition continues, but since the lairs hold many of the artifacts created during the Age of Magic, those lucky enough to survive the raids are often rewarded with the Mithril they were hunting.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Découvert d'abord à l'Âge de Magie, le mithril est plus solide et plus clair que l'acier. Les nains, les premier à le découvrir, prirent l'habitude de répandre la rumeur que le métal blanc était de l'os de dragon sculpté et rirent de cette compétition à aller dans les repaires de dragon pour essayer d'en récupérer. Aujourd'hui la tradition continue, mais depuis que les trésors de dragons contiennent beaucoup d'objets fabriqués durant l'Âge de Magie, ceux assez fortunés pour survivre aux raids sont souvent récompensés avec le mithril qu'ils recherchaient.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Im Zeitalter der Magie entdeckt, ist Mithril härter und leichter als Stahl. Die Zwerge, die es entdeckten, verbreiteten das Gerücht, das weiße Metall sei geschnitzter Drachenknochen und lachten, als ihre Konkurrenz die Drachenhöhlen durchsuchten, um etwas davon zu finden. Diese Tradition besteht auch heute noch, da es aber in Drachennestern viele Artefakte zu finden gibt, die während des Zeitalters der Magie geschaffen wurden, werden die Glücklichen, die die Raubzüge überleben, oftmals mit dem Mithril ausgezeichnet, welches sie suchten.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Scoperto la prima volta nell'Era della Magia il Mithril è più resistente e leggero dell'acciaio. I Nani, i primi a scoprirlo, sparsero la voce che quel metallo bianco fosse in realtà osso di drago lavorato e risero quando la concorrenza entravano nei nascondigli dei draghi cercando di recuperarne un pò. Oggi la tradizione continua, ma siccome i nascondigli contengono molti degli artefatti creati durante l'Era della Magia coloro sufficentemente fortunati a sopravvivere alle esplorazioni sono spesso ricompensati con il Mithril che stavano cercando.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Descubierto por primera vez en la Edad de la Magia, el Mithril es más fuerte y ligero que el acero. Los Enanos, sus descubridores, lo utilizaron para difundir el rumor de que el metal blanco era hueso de dragon escarbado y se regocijaron mientras su competición se adentraba en lo profundo de los cubiles de los dragones para intentar coger un poco. Hoy la tradición continúa, pero desde que los cubiles empezaron a guardar muchos artefactos creados durante la Edad de la Magia, aquellos lo suficientemente afortunados que sobreviven a las incursiones también son recompensados con el Mithril que andaban buscando.

They are not real plants and can survive without light, provided there is enough organic matter to feed them. As such, they are farmed underground and are a main food in the Underhome. But almost every civilization has a favoured breed of mushrooms, as during the Age of Ice, when humans and non-humans alike were often forced to live underground, mushrooms were staples of their diet.

TEXT.English: Obsidian
TEXT.French: Obsidienne
TEXT.German: Obsidian
TEXT.Italian: Ossidiana
TEXT.Spanish: Obsidian

TEXT.English: Obsidian is a naturally occurring volcanic glass formed as an extrusive igneous rock. It is produced when felsic lava extruded from a volcano cools without crystal growth. Obsidian is commonly found within the margins of rhyolitic lava flows known as obsidian flows, where the chemical composition (high silica content) induces a high viscosity of the lava. Because of the lack of crystal structure, obsidian blade edges can reach incredible thinness, leading to its use as projectile points and scalpel blades.

Il filo delle lame in ossidiana può essere incredibilmente sottile e tagliente, portando al suo utilizzo nella creazione di oggetti taglienti (coltelli) e perforanti (punte di freccia e lancia) oltre a essere usata per oggetti decorativi.

TEXT.English: Pearls
TEXT.French: Perles
TEXT.German: Perlen
TEXT.Italian: Perle
TEXT.Spanish: Perlas

TEXT.English: [TAB]A shelly concretion, usually rounded, and having a brilliant luster, with varying tints, found in the mantle, or between the mantle and shell of pearl oysters and river mussels. It is usually due to a secretion of shelly substance around some irritating foreign particle. Its substance is the same as nacre, or mother-of-pearl. Pearls that are round, or nearly round, and of fine luster, are highly esteemed as jewels and compare in value with the precious stones.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Une concrétion de coquillage, habituellement arrondie, et possédant un éclat brillant, avec les teintes variables, trouvée dans la valve, ou entre la valve et la coquille d'huîtres perlières et de mulettes d'eau douce. C'est généralement du à la sécrétion d'une substance autour d'une particule étrangère irritante. Sa substance est la même que la nacre ou le burgau. Les perles qui sont rondes, ou presque rondes, et d'un bel éclat, sont hautement estimées comme les bijoux, et sont d'une valeur comparable à celle des pierres précieuses.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Eine schalige, normalerweise rundliche Absonderung mit einem schimmernden Glanz in wechselnden Farbtönen. Sie werden in der Umhüllung oder zwischen Hülle und Schale von Perlenaustern oder Flussmuscheln gefunden. Gewöhnlich handelt es sich dabei um Schalensubstanz, die sich um einen Fremdpartikel legt, und die das gleiche wie Perlmutt ist. Perlen, die kugelrund sind, oder fast kugelrund, und einen edlen Glanz haben, werden als Juwelen hoch geschätzt und sind im Wert vergleichbar mit edlen Steinen.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Le perle sono di solito rotonde, e hanno una lucentezza brillante, con vari colori, e si trova nel mantello o tra il mantello e il guscio dei molluschi (in particolare delle ostriche). La perla non è altro che un corpo estraneo che viene ricoperto di madreperla per proteggere i tessuti dell'animale dall'irritazione. Le pearle che sono particolarmente sferiche, e di raffinata lucentezza, sono molto apprezzate come gioielli e sono simili come valore alle pietre preziose.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]A shelly concretion, normalmente redonda, y con un lustre brillante, con varios tonos, se encuentran en el manto, o entre el manto y la concha de ostras y moluscos de río. Se debe normalmente a la secreción de una sustancia alrededor de una partícula externa irritada. Su sustancia es la misma que el nácar, o madreperla. Las perlas que son redondas, o aproximadamente redondas, y con un lustre fino, son consideradas joyas de alta estima, y comparable al valor de algunas piedras preciosas.

TEXT.English: Razorweed
TEXT.French: Herbelame
TEXT.German: Klingengras
TEXT.Italian: Erba Rasoio
TEXT.Spanish: Hierbacortante

TEXT.English: [TAB]Sometimes called "Bloodweed" or "Assassin's Gift," Razorweed is a horrid plant that first grew in hell. It was later taken into creation, though difficult to grow in captivity because of its unruly habit of killing its gardener. That tendency made it a favorite gift of assassins, who would sneak it into their victims gardens, where, once it had grown to maturity, the plant would perform the assassins work.[NEWLINE][TAB]Composed mostly of vines with strong, hollow thorns along its length, dark sacs of blood can blossom along its length after feeding.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Parfois appelée "herbesang" ou "cadeau de lassassin", lherbelame est une horrible plante qui poussa tout dabord en enfer. Elle fut importée plus tard dans la création, bien que difficile à faire pousser en captivité car elle tue en général son jardinier. Cette tendance en a fait lun des cadeaux favoris des assassins, qui se cache dans le jardin des victimes et les tue quand elle a assez grandi.[NEWLINE][TAB]La plante elle-même est principalement constituée de lianes grimpantes parsemées de dures épines. Lorsquelle sest nourrie, de sombres poches de sang peuvent fleurir sur toute sa longueur.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Das manchmal auch "Blutgras" oder "Geschenk an die Mörder" genannte Klingengras ist eine abscheuliche Pflanze, die zuerst in der Hölle wuchs. Später wurde sie dann gezüchtet, obwohl sie schwierig anzubauen war - denn in der Regel tötete sie ihre Gärtner. Diese Eigenart machte sie für Attentäter zu einem bevorzugten "Präsent" - sie pflanzten heimlich ein Exemplar im Garten des Opfers, das ihn töten würde sobald es nur groß genug geworden war.[NEWLINE][TAB]Die Pflanze an sich besteht zum Großteil aus Reben, mit stabilen, hohlen Dornen. Nach dem Verspeisen von Beute können dunkle Blutsäcke auf ihr gedeihen.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]A volte chiamata "Erba del sangue" o "Regalo dell'Assassino", l'Erba Rasoio è un orrida pianta che prima cresceva solo all'inferno. È stata poi inserità nella creazione, anche se difficile da coltivare a causa della sua abitudine di uccidere il suo giardiniere. Questa tendenza la ha resa il regalo preferito degli assassini, che la inseriscono di nascosto nel giardino delle loro vittime, dove, una volta cresciuta abbastanza, compiera il lavoro dell'assassino.[NEWLINE][TAB]Composta principalmente di viticci con spesse spine cave lungo tutta la loro lunghezza. Sacche scure di sangue possono sbocciare lungo tutta la pianta dopo essersi nutrita.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Denominada a veces "Hierba Sangrienta" u "Obsequio del Asesino", la Hierbacortante es una planta horrible que creció primero en el infierno. Después fue traída a la creación, aunque es difícil de plantar en cautividad porque normalmente podría matar a su jardinero. Esa tendencia la convirtió en un regalo preferido por los asesinos, que se infiltraría en los jardines de sus víctimas donde los acabaría matando cuando creciera lo suficientemente largo.[NEWLINE][TAB]La planta en sí es principalmente un conjunto de vides con espinas fuertes y huecas a lo largo de ella. Después de alimentarse de bolsas oscuras de sangre puede florecer.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Reagents are plants that are specially tended and prepared to be used in spellcasting. The caster taps into the latent magical energy in the reagents and is able to access more powerful spells, as he doesn't have to rely on just the power developed in his or her own body.
TEXT.French: Les réactifs sont des plantes qui sont spécialement entretenues et préparées pour être utilisées pour lancer des sorts. Le lanceur puise dans l'énergie magique latente contenue dans les réactifs et ainsi est capable de lancer des sorts plus puissants car il n'a plus à compter sur son seul corps comme focus.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Reagenzien sind Pflanzen, die sehr gut für die Zauberei geeignet sind. Wenn ein Zauberer die verborgene Magie innerhalb dieser Pflanzen anzapft, kann er mächtigere Sprüche benutzen, da er auf mehr als nur seinen eigenen Körper als Fokus zurückgreifen kann.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]I reagenti sono piante che sono specificatamente coltivate e lavorate per essere usate nel lancio di magie. L'incantatore attinge alla magia latente dei ragenti ed è capace di lanciare magie più potenti, cosi da non dover fare affidamento solo sul potere sviluppato dal suo corpo.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Los Reactivos son plantas que son especialmente preparadas para el lanzamiento de hechizos. El lanzador explota la energía mágica latente en los reactivos y es capaz de acceder a hechizos más poderosos debido a ello, ya que no tiene que recurrir a su propio cuerpo como foco.

TEXT.English: Salt
TEXT.French: Sel
TEXT.German: Salz
TEXT.Italian: Sale
TEXT.Spanish: Sal

TEXT.English: [TAB]Salt has been one of the most valued commodities in the history of mankind - among other reasons, humans need a certain amount of salt in their diet to survive. Humans have been harvesting salt for thousands of years; the practice started in the dim recesses of history, long before any written records were made. [PARAGRAPH:2]One of salt's greatest properties is its ability to preserve food. Before the development of reliable refrigeration, one of the few known ways to keep food from becoming inedible was to apply salt, which delays or prevents microbial invasion. (Some kinds of foods can also by preserved by "smoking" them.) In addition to its preservative qualities, salt also simply makes food taste better. [PARAGRAPH:2]One of the earliest-discovered methods of harvesting salt was by evaporating seawater under the sun, a very tedious and expensive process, leading to high prices for this important good. It wouldn't be until the mid-nineteenth century - when salt mining was widely practiced across the world - that this commodity would become much less expensive, no longer "worth its weight in gold," as it was commonly described.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le sel a été l'un des produits les plus évalués dans l'histoire de l'humanité - entre d'autres raisons, le besoin d'humains par certaine quantité de sel dans leur régime de survivre. Les humains avaient moissonné le sel pour des milliers d'années ; la pratique a commencé dans les faibles cavités de l'histoire, longtemps avant que tous les écrits aient été notés. [ PARAGRAPH:2]One des plus grandes propriétés du sel est sa capacité de conserver la nourriture. Avant le développement de la réfrigération fiable, une des quelques manières connues de conserver la nourriture de devenir non comestible devait appliquer le sel, qui retarde ou empêche l'invasion microbienne. (quelques genres de nourritures mettent en boîte également par préservé "en les fumant".) En plus de ses qualités préservatives, salez rend également simplement le goût de nourriture meilleur. [ PARAGRAPH:2]One des méthodes tôt-découvertes de moissonner le sel était en évaporant l'eau de mer sous le soleil, un processus très pénible et cher, menant aux prix élevés de ce bon important. Elle n'aurait pas lieu jusqu'au mi-dix-neuvième siècle - quand l'exploitation de sel n'a été plus largement pratiquée à travers le monde que ce produit deviendrait beaucoup moins cher, "en valeur son poids en or," pendant qu'elle était généralement décrite.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Salz ist eins der bewerteten Gebrauchsgüter in der Geschichte der Menschheit - unter anderen Gründen gewesen, Menschen Notwendigkeit ein bestimmte Menge Salz in ihrer Diät zu überleben. Menschen haben Salz für Tausenden Jahre geerntet; die Praxis begann in den schwachen Aussparungen der Geschichte, lange zuvor alle mögliche schriftlichen Aufzeichnungen gebildet wurden. [ PARAGRAPH:2]One der größten Eigenschaften des Salzes ist seine Fähigkeit, Nahrung zu konservieren. Vor der Entwicklung der zuverlässigen Abkühlung, sollte eine der wenigen bekannten Weisen, Nahrung vom Werden zu halten ungenießbar Salz anwenden, das Mikrobeninvasion verzögert oder verhindert. (einige Arten Nahrungsmittel machen auch ein, durch konserviert, indem sie sie."rauchen") Zusätzlich zu seinen konservierenden Qualitäten salzen Sie auch bildet einfach Nahrungsmittelgeschmack besser. [ PARAGRAPH:2]One der früh-entdeckten Methoden des Erntens des Salzes war, indem es Meerwasser unter der Sonne, einem sehr langwierigen und kostspieligen Prozeß verdunstete und zu hohe Preise für dieses wichtige gute führte. Es würde sein nicht bis das mittler-19.jahrhundert - als Salzbergbau weit über der Welt - die dieses Gebrauchsgut viel weniger kostspielig werden würde, nicht mehr "wert sein Gewicht im Gold," geübt wurde, während er allgemein beschrieben wurde.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Il sale è stato uno dei prodotti più preziosi nella storia dell'umanità - tra i vari motivi, la necessità degli esseri umani di una determinata quantità di sale nella loro dieta per sopravvivere. Gli esseri umani stanno raccogliendo il sale da migliaia di anni; una pratica iniziata nella storia più remota, molto prima che si scrivesse la storia. [ PARAGRAPH:2]Una delle principali proprietà del sale è la capacità di conservare il cibo. Prima dello sviluppo di un affidabile refrigerazione, uno dei pochi modi conosciuti per conservare il cibo dal deperire era usare il sale, che ritardarda o impedisce l'invasione microbica (alcuni tipi di cibo possono essere conservati anche atrtaverso l'affumicatura). Oltre alle capacità di conservazione, il sale rende il sapore di alcuni cibi migliore. [ PARAGRAPH:2]Uno dei primi metodi scoperti per la raccolta del sale era far evaporare l'acqua di mare sotto il sole, un processo molto noioso e costoso, motivo del costo elevato di tale importante bene. Cio non cambiera sino alla metà del diciannovesimo secolo - quando la raccolta e l'estrazione mineraria del sale sono ampiamente svolte nell mondo che questo bene diventerà molto meno costoso, non valendo più "il suo peso in oro", come veniva comunemente descritto.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]La sal ha sido una de las materias valoradas de la historia de la humanidad - entre otras razones, necesidad de los seres humanos a cierta cantidad de sal en su dieta de sobrevivir. Los seres humanos han estado cosechando la sal para los millares de años; la práctica comenzó en las hendiduras déviles de la historia, mucho antes cualquier expediente escrito fue hecho. [ PARAGRAPH:2]One de las características más grandes de la sal es su capacidad de preservar el alimento. Antes del desarrollo de la refrigeración confiable, una de las pocas maneras sabidas de guardar el alimento de llegar a ser no comestible debía aplicar la sal, que retrasa o previene la invasión microbiana. (algunas clases de alimentos conservan también por preservado "fumándolos".) Además de sus calidades preservativas, sale también simplemente hace gusto del alimento mejor. [ PARAGRAPH:2]One de los métodos temprano-descubiertos de cosechar la sal estaba evaporando el agua de mar bajo el sol, proceso muy aburrido y costoso, conduciendo a los precios altos elevados para este bueno importante. No sería hasta el mediados de-diecinueveavo siglo - cuando la explotación minera de la sal fue practicada extensamente a través del mundo que esta materia llegó a ser mucho menos costosa, no más de largo "digno de su peso en oro," mientras que fue descrita comúnmente.

TEXT.English: Sheut Stone
TEXT.French: Malpierre
TEXT.German: Seelensteine
TEXT.Italian: Pietra Sheut
TEXT.Spanish: Piedra Sombría

TEXT.English: [TAB]Only Agares knows the origin of these stones. They may be a pale reflection of the gems of creation or Agares's failed attempts to make his own. Regardless, they radiate powerful death magic and draw wraiths to them like silent beacons. During the Age of Magic necromancers were said to have turned the stones into powerful weapons for those that wielded them.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Seul Agares connaît l'origine de ces pierres. Elles sont peut être le pâle reflet des gemmes de la Création ou une tentative avortée d'Agares pour créer les siennes. Quoi qu'il en soit, elles irradient d'une puissante magie de mort et attirent les fantômes comme une balise silencieuse. On dit que durant l'Âge de la Magie, les nécromants transformèrent ces pierres en de puissantes armes pour ceux qui les maniaient.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Nur Agares kennt die Herkunft dieser Steine. Vielleicht sind sie ein schwacher Abglanz der Schöpfungssteine oder Agares' Versuch, eigene zu schaffen, schlug fehl. Wie auch immer, von ihnen geht starke Todesmagie aus und sie ziehen wie ein stilles Leuchtfeuer Gespenster an. Von Totenbeschwörern heißt es, dass sie im Zeitalter der Magie die Steine für ihre Besitzer in mächtige Waffen verwandelt haben.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Solo Agares conosce l'origine di queste pietre. Possono essere un pallido riflessodelle gemme della creazione o il risultato dei tentativi falliti di Agares di crearne di sue. Indipendentemente da ciò, esse emanano una fortissima magia della morte e attirano verso di loro i wraiths come fari silenziosi. Si dice che, durante l'Era della Magia, i necromanti trasformassero le pietre in potentissime armi per coloro che le maneggiavano.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Sólo Agares conoce el origen de estas piedras. Pueden ser un reflejo pálido de las gemas de la creación o un intento fallido de Agares de crear la suya propia. De cualquier forma irradian magia de muerte potente y dibuja espectros en ellas como balizas silenciosas. Durante la Edad de la Magia se decía que los nigromantes convirtieron las piedras en poderosas armas para aquellos que pudieran manejarlas.

TEXT.English: Shrimp
TEXT.French: Crevettes
TEXT.German: Garnelen
TEXT.Italian: Gamberetti
TEXT.Spanish: Shrimp

TEXT.English: Shrimp are aquatic crustaceans classified in the infraorder Caridea, found widely around the world in both fresh and salt water. Adult shrimp are filter feeding benthic animals living close to the bottom. They can live in schools and can swim rapidly backwards. Shrimp are an important food source for larger animals from fish to whales. They have a high resistance to toxins in polluted areas, and may contribute to high toxin levels in their predators. Together with prawns, shrimp are widely caught and farmed for human consumption.

TEXT.German: Garnelen sind aquatische Krustentiere, die zur Ordnung der Caridea gehören. Man findet sie überall auf der Welt in Süß- und Salzwasser. Erwachsene Garnelen ernähren sich durch das Herausfiltern von Krill aus den Wasserschichten nah am Boden. Sie leben in Schulen und können sich sehr schnell rückwärts bewegen. Garnelen sind eine wichtige Nahrungsquelle für große Tiere wie Fische und Wale. Sie sind sehr widerstandsfähig gegenüber den Giften in verschmutzten Gegenden und können so zur Anreicherung der Toxine in ihren Fressfeinden führen. Zusammen mit Riesengarnelen werden Garnelen weltweit gefangen und für den menschlichen Verbrauch in Farmen gezüchtet.
TEXT.Italian: I gamberetti (caridea) sono crostacei acquatici, diffusi intorno al mondo sia in acqua salata che dolce. La maggior parte dei gamberetti sono onnivori, ma alcune specie si nutrono filtrando l'acqua. Possono vivere in branchi e nuotare rapidamente all'indietro. I gamberetti sono un'importante fonte di cibo per gli animali più grandi, dai pesci alle balene. Hanno un'elevata resistenza alle tossine delle aree inquinate pertanto possono contribuire agli alti tassi di tossine presenti nei loro predatori. Insieme ai gamberi comuni, i gamberetti sono ampiamente pescati e allevati per il consumo umano.

TEXT.English: [TAB]A common delicacy in the hells, Toads are much less useful in Erebus. They can be found on hell terrain and in jungles.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Friandise commune aux Enfers, les crapauds ne sont présents que les terrains infernaux et disparaîtront si le terrain est reconverti à la normale.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Kröten sind in der Hölle eine beliebte Delikatesse und können nur auf Höllenfeldern gefunden werden. Verschwinden diese und werden in normales Gebiet zurückverwandelt, verschwinden auch die Kröten.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Una prelibatezza comune negli inferi, i Rospi sono molto meno utili su Erebus. Possono essere trovati sul terreno Infernale e nella giungla.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Una delicia común en los infiernos, los Sapos sólo pueden encontrarse en terrero infernal y desaparecerán si el terreno vuelve a su estado normal.
